Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
      • Animal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Living
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Carnivore, Herbivore, Omnivore

    public abstract class Animal
extends Entity
implements Living
    Represents an Animal that is a subclass of Entity and implements the Living interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int cantMove
      The minimum age that this Animal must be before it can act.
      protected char[] dangerChars
      An Array of characters that stores the character representations of Entities that poses a threat to this Animal.
      protected int energy
      The current amount of energy this Animal has.
      protected char[] foodChars
      An Array of characters that stores the character representations of Entities that this Animal can eat.
      protected int lifespan
      The maximum age that this Animal can be before it dies.
      protected static double MAX_ENERGY
      The maximum amount of energy this Animal can have before it stops going after food.
      protected static double MAX_SIGHT_DISTANCE
      The farthest this Animal can see from its own location.
      protected int reproduceAge
      The minimum age that this Animal must be before it can give birth.
      protected int reproduceEnergy
      The minimum amount of energy this Animal needs to give birth.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal(World world,
              Location location)
        Creates a new Animal that exists in a given World and is initially located at a given Location. Its lifespan can be any integer between 15 and 17. Its reproduceEnergy can be any integer between 27 and 29. Its starting energy can be any integer between 10 and 14. Its reproduceAge can be any integer between 7 and 9.
        Parameters:
        world - The World in which this Animal exists.
        location - The initial Location where this Animal is located.

    • Method Detail

      • getEnergy

        public int getEnergy()
        Gets this Animal's current amount of energy.
        Specified by:
        getEnergy in interface Living
        Returns:
        this Animal's energy.

      • weighOptions

        public int weighOptions()
        Gets the best direction that this Animal should move in, as shown below. Movement 1 4 0 2 3
        Returns:
        a direction that this Animal should move in.

      • giveBirth

        public abstract boolean giveBirth()
        Allows this Animal to attempt to give birth and returns a boolean value of whether or not it was successful.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of whether or not this Animal actually gave birth. True if it did give birth. False otherwise.

      • move

        public void move(int direction)
        Changes the location of this Animal depending on what direction it is heading towards.
        Parameters:
        direction - An integer between 0 and 4 inclusively that represents the direction in which this Animal is heading towards. Movement 1 4 0 2 3

      • getBestBirthPlace

        public Location getBestBirthPlace(int direction)
        Gets the best Location where this Animal's baby can be initialized to. If there is not valid location for the baby, then it returns null.
        Parameters:
        direction - An integer between 0 and 4 inclusively that represents the direction in which this Animal might give birth in. Movement 1 4 0 2 3
        Returns:
        the best location where this Animal's baby should be born in. If null is returned, then there is no such location and this Animal does not give birth successfully.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove()
        Determines whether or not this Animal can move depending on its age. This Animal must have an age that is greater than or equal to its cantMove field to return true.
        Returns:
        a boolean value of whether or not this Animal can move. True if this Animal can move. False otherwise.

      • weighOptions

        public int weighOptions(boolean noStay)
        Determines which direction this Animal should go in for its next move.
        Parameters:
        noStay - A boolean value that discourages this Animal from staying in its current location if it is true.
        Returns:
        the best direction that this Animal should go in.

      • eat

        public void eat(Living eaten)
        Causes this Animal to eat another Living Entity in the World that they belong to. This Animal gains the amount of energy that the eaten Living Entity has. The eaten Living Entity also removes itself from the World since it is no longer alive.
        Parameters:
        eaten - An Entity that is Living, which this Animal eats and gains energy from.

      • act

        public void act()
        A method that tells this Animal to do something. It makes sures that this Animal is alive before proceeding. If this Animal reached its lifespan or has no more energy, then it dies by removing itself from its World. If this Animal is not yet able to move, it does nothing. Otherwise, this Animal will see if it is capable of giving birth to another Animal. If it is, then it does so. Otherwise, this Animal sees if it can move to another Location where it may or may not eat food. If this Animal has less than 8 energy units, then it changes to an Omnivore, if it already isn't one in order to have a wider range of Animals to eat. This makes the Animals more adaptable and capable of surviving longer to create a sustainable World.
        Specified by:
        act in class Entity
